comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Explore! Wow! ;-) These 'time lapse' photos were taken from on top of the old Hotel Manly, built 1924, and a seven-storey addition added in 1935. Demolished in March 1989. See - manlylocalstudies.blogspot.com.au/2009/04/hotel-manly.html

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: I am not seeing the wires for the tram in this picture.

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mich2009] The shots were taken only a couple of weeks before the Manly Lines closed.The line disappearing to the left is the remnant of the line that once services the cargo wharf. Retained for a period I would imagine to temporarily stable trams in the electric era between trips. The tracks remained in the streets of Manly for many years, I remember them around the wharf area and in Belgrave Street in the 1950s. I guess we had other priorities between 1940 and 1945!

comment._content: I can see the wires now.
